messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kelly's back
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/4/2003 11:44:46 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Me too! ... Yeah, but just so everyone knows, there ll HAVE to be a year layoff  (or two)
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/4/2003 11:44:46 AM Eastern Standard Time,
abtleo@... writes:


> Sounds perfect! How wonderful for you. I hope your boys like it.

Me too!

> I love that you're still thinking conference, just in a new place. Kelly
> the conference queen!

Yeah, but just so everyone knows, there'll HAVE to be a year layoff (or two)
while we build and get settled! Don't go counting chickens, y'all!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kelly's back
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sounds perfect!  How wonderful for you.  I hope your boys like it. I love that you re still thinking conference, just in a new place.  Kelly the conference
messages.messageBody:
2/4/03 10:34:

> We looked at many possible pieces of land through a realtor and had about
> given up. ;-( Then we saw an ad---for sale by owner---in a local newspaper.
> Ten acres---12 years pesticide free, so seven years organic! It was an old
> dairy farm. A bubbly creek runs through it (potable!). Five acres flat with
> five acres rolling almost all pasture. A few evergreens and some hardwoods on
> the hills. With views, in a little cove with really cool neighbors (one
> single mom with a 10 year old son she homeschools). 18 miles west of
> Asheville, NC.
>
> I'm taking the boys up this weekend to get their opinions. (Duncan will be
> all for it as there are horses that live next door! <g>)

Sounds perfect! How wonderful for you. I hope your boys like it.

I love that you're still thinking conference, just in a new place. Kelly
the conference queen!

brenda
